meanings.definition: A small, thin, sharp piece of wood, glass, or metal that has broken off from a larger piece.
meanings.sent1: I got a splinter in my finger from the wooden bench.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to touch the splinter, it might hurt you.
meanings.sent3: The tiny splinter decided to take a break from the wooden plank.
meanings.sent4: Her words felt like a splinter in his heart, piercing deeply.
meanings.sent5: The splinter gleamed in the sunlight, waiting to be removed.

meanings.definition: To break or split into small, thin, sharp pieces.
meanings.sent1: I accidentally splintered the wooden chair while moving it.
meanings.sent2: The glass splintered into tiny shards upon impact.
meanings.sent3: The cake seemed to splinter into crumbs as soon as it was cut.
meanings.sent4: His heart splintered into a million pieces when she said goodbye.
meanings.sent5: The rock splintered into fragments as it hit the ground.

meanings.definition: A group or faction that has broken away from a larger organization or group.
meanings.sent1: The splinter formed their own political party after disagreements.
meanings.sent2: The splinter demanded independence from the main group.
meanings.sent3: The splinter group decided to start their own book club.
meanings.sent4: The splinter faction gained support from dissatisfied members.
meanings.sent5: The splinter organization aimed to create a new path forward.
